title: The VIP Lounge: Stephanie Szostak
text:
FAMILY PHOTO
Stephanie Szostak and her sons before a Red Sox game at Fenway Park in 2012.
By Juliet Pennington Globe Correspondent August 29, 2015
French-American actress Stephanie Szostak has been on the big screen in “Iron Man 3,” “Dinner for Schmucks,” “The Devil Wears Prada,” among others, but these days she’s getting attention opposite Matt Passmore in the USA Network series “Satisfaction,” which filmed its second season this summer in Atlanta. Szostak, 40, hails from La Celle Saint-Cloud, west of Paris, but lives in Connecticut with her husband and two sons. She’s an avid golfer (she played at the College of William & Mary in Williamsburg, Va.) and loves to travel — especially to the seaside retreat of Capbreton in southwestern France. We caught up with Szostak to talk all things travel.
Favorite vacation spot? Our summer vacation in Capbreton, for the family, love, beauty of the region, and amazing food — all of which contribute to complete and utter relaxation.

Favorite food or drink while vacationing? Aperitif time with an IPA or lager around 6 p.m., with some charcuteries or peanuts.
Where would you like to travel to but haven’t? South Africa, Kenya, Costa Rica, Vietnam, Turkey, etc. The best of traveling for me is experiencing the different pace of life, cultures, and feeling completely out of my comfort zone.
One item you can’t leave home without when traveling? My contact lens solution.
Aisle or window? Either-or. Window to rest my head, and aisle for easy access to the can.
Favorite childhood travel memory? A dude ranch in Gaylord, Mich., where I went every year for a week from ages 5 to 14: horses, hayrides, summer heat, the smell of pine needles, water skiing, s’mores, and pure happiness.
Guilty pleasure when traveling? Not working out — and cracking open that IPA at 9 a.m. Just kidding.
Best travel tip? Plan just enough, but not too much. Be spontaneous and don’t feel guilty about being lazy.
